clinical_study.brief_title: Use of a Remifentanil-propofol Mixture in Patients Undergoing Breast Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Use of a Remifentanil-propofol Mixture in Patients With Breast Cancer Undergoing Breast Cancer Surgery: a Prospective Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Co-administration of propofol and remifentanil is considered to be an ideal total intravenous anesthesia technique, which is widely used in induction and maintenance of general anesthesia. Remifentanil and propofol can be mixed in polypropylene syringes for one hour with a remaining concentration of 91% in small concentrations of remifentanil. However, delivery of remifentanil-propofol mixture by target-controlled infusion(TCI) for general anesthesia in surgical procedure has not been described. Breast cancer surgery ( including modified radical mastectomy and breast-conserving surgery) is a less time-consuming procedure for patients with breast cancer with one-hour duration in our hospital. This pilot study was to examine the merit of remifentanil-propofol mixture as a GA regimen for breast cancer surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Previous studies has described the feasibility and safety of remifentanil-propofol mixture use in sedation of pediatric patients undergoing magnetic resonance imaging or flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 84 patients scheduled for breast cancer surgery were randomly allocated to receive TIVA with propofol and remifentanil separately by two TCI pump (Separate group) or with remifentanil-propofol mixture by single TCI pump (Mix group), all TCI concentration adjustments during operation were based on BIS and ANI monitor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA II or III
- age more than 18 years
- scheduled for breast cancer surgery under general anesthesia.
Exclusion Criteria:
- previously allergic to propofol or remifentanil
- combining other surgical procedure leading to extended operative time
